title: Lost work
content:
Today I was filling in a contract with a government organization. The type that allows me to answer questions and submit. I clicked on something else before finishing and I could not retrieve my work.

I have tried ALL of the suggestions available in HISTORY (restore previous session) open closed tabs etc Etc.

Nothing works
creator: bruce106

title: no audio in firefox
content:
I'm not getting audio playin in Firefox, and I can confirm audio plays okay in Chrome all okay. Have tried the following:..

(1) Checked the Firefox privacy settings for audio .. Nothing being blocked (2) Checked Windows mixer settings .. Nothing being blocked (3) Cleared browser cache in Firefox .. No changes (4) Undertook Firefox refresh .. No changes (5) Reinstalled audio drivers .. No changes (6) Downloaded Firefox Developers edition .. Audio does work

So my conclusion is that there is a problem with normal edition of Firefox with playing audio ?

What wrong here and how do I get it fixed please ?
creator: david_lofthouse

title: Latest version of Firefox breaks everything
content: I have been using Firefox for years and it has been my favorite browser. I am running on a laptop with Windows 10 at the latest version. Until the latest update to Firefox, all was great. Now, only after the latest version of Firefox, I consistently get messages about link timing out when I click on anything. Usually, it takes 2 or 3 clicks to open a new tab. What has happened with the latest version? Can I undo the latest version? Thanks for any help. I can't wait 30 seconds for every tab or window to open.
creator: johnw2work

title: No authentication code
content: Occasionally after a power outage I have to reestablish my Mozilla account. I'm asked to enter my authentication code. Years ago, I was given a list of 8 different 10-digit authentication codes as well as a 32 character "Recovery Key". None of them have ever worked. I end up having to sign back in to my account using my Apple or Google accounts. How do I get my original Mozilla authentication code back or get a new one that works?
creator: 47z8g7r9cz

title: embedded video
content: firefox refuses to open an embedded video - SOMETIMES. other people are watching it but i cannot. why won't firefox FIX THIS
creator: coelacanth

title: Possible Javascript display issue
content:
When I am on espn.com/fantasy team pages everything loads correctly except for one popup table that does not. It will occasionally display but usually doesn't. When it fails to display, the scrollbar disappears but nothing shows. I tried clearing cache and cookies (Ctrl + F5, Settings + Clear data, etc.), refreshing firefox, and disabling all addons/extensions but the problem persists. I also tried turning off hardware acceleration and turned off proxies and secure DNS but nothing worked. I noticed this "_error.js" message in the debugger:

module.exports = __NEXT_REGISTER_PAGE("/_error", function () { 

 var e = webpackJsonp(    [566],    {      1789: function (e, r, o) {        e.exports = o(288)      },    },    [1789],  )  return { page: e.default }

})


I do not have this issue on firefox android, only on desktop. Thank you.
creator: subzero936

title: Latest update keeps asking for master password
content: The new version keeps asking me for my master password even though I've previously put it in. What changed with the latest version (132.0)?
creator: danohall

title: Content is missing
content:
I was filling out a City of Portland nuisance complaint form, but the "SUBMIT" button would not appear in order for the complaint form to be transmitted. I could only scroll down so far -- there was nothing more, no page two, etc. Email to City confirmed the problem with the form was on my end. Then I used Safari to get that same City complaint form. Same site, same form. But, on Safari there was about a full page more to the form that had been missing on Firefox. Additional questions, boxes to check, spaces to fill, places to upload photos/files. And at the bottom of the form was the "SUBMIT" button. I don't think I've had this particular issue with other forms, questionnaires, etc. elsewhere. Is there a filter or something blocking random stuff?

I'm not able to Screenshot the page as shown in Safari, so: https://www.portland.gov/homelessness-impact-reduction/report-campsite I think I can "Add image" as a screenshot of the form as shown in Firefox . . . . . . . . . . . . . . oh well, turns out I don't know how to make all that happen. Thanks for whatever anyone can come up with.
creator: jabarnas
